intro: Urophyllum chloranthum, commonly known as the green chloranthum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Chloranthaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually smooth and dark green. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, giving it a subtle and delicate appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
